Description: Cake-shaped weight carved from black hard stone, likely basalt; with convex top, flat base and marked carination (but not usual sharp edge); smoothed surface
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Oriental Institute, University of Chicago. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
This specimen corresponds to 50 kedets (Petrie 1886, 75 no. 18)
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 75 no. 18, pl. XXI, no. 34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (VA.647) (phase 3)
